quote: Simulation results demonstrate the efﬁcacy of the proposed method in detecting manufacturing faults with only a small number of test vectors.
Fully Programmable Valve Array (FPV A) has emerged as a new architecture for the next-generation ﬂow-based microﬂuidic biochips.
Our method is based on the construction of ﬂow paths and cut- sets in the array, followed by a hierarchical ILP-based solution, which yields a very compact test set.
To detect faults in a ﬂow-based biochip, the method in [9] connects air pressure sources to the input ports of the biochip to generate a pressure in the ﬂow layer.
In order to facilitate industry adoption of FPV As, efﬁcient defect-screening techniques must be developed.
